events.message: The customer reported a car collision incident involving another vehicle that occurred on March 30th at an intersection.
The claim was officially categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and identifying the involvement of the insured car.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the case and liaise with the customer to gather necessary information for the claim processing.
Customer was notified that the insurance company has acknowledged the accident claim and will begin reviewing all submitted materials promptly.
The agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and the collision details to proceed with the investigation.
Customer uploaded all required documents including photos of the accident damage and a copy of the police collision report as requested.
The insurance company initiated the investigation process to verify the claim details and assess liability for the vehicle accident.
The investigation has been completed, confirming that the customer’s vehicle was damaged due to the collision caused by the other party.
A settlement in the amount covering the repair costs of the damaged vehicle was proposed to the customer based on the investigation findings.
The customer responded positively, agreeing to the proposed settlement after reviewing the terms and confirming the coverage details.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company to proceed with the disbursement of the settlement for vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully issued to the customer’s designated account to cover the repair expenses for the damaged car following the accident.
The claim file was closed after the payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that the vehicle repairs have been arranged.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim have been archived in compliance with company policy for future reference.
